skill.name: gitlab
skill.description: GitLab operations via glab CLI. Use when user mentions: MR, merge request, gitlab issue, pipeline, CI status, glab, or when git remote shows gitlab.com or self-hosted GitLab.
skill.summary: GitLab operations via glab CLI. Use when user mentions: MR, merge request, gitlab issue, pipeline, C...
skill.author: ETeissonniere

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only prompt guidelines and glab command references. Static findings are false positives: SHA-256 hashes flagged as weak crypto (SHA-256 is secure), 'sudo' in package installation docs flagged as privilege escalation (legitimate apt install command), content hashes flagged as C2 keywords (standard Git metadata), backtick notation flagged as shell execution (standard markdown documentation), and git remote detection flagged as reconnaissance (legitimate GitLab detection). No executable code or security risks present.

content.user_title: Manage GitLab merge requests and issues
content.value_statement: GitLab projects require separate CLI commands for merge requests, issues, and pipelines. This skill provides quick access to glab commands for all GitLab operations. Automate your GitLab workflow directly from Claude.
actual_capabilities: Create, view, and manage merge requests with full context
Create, list, and close GitLab issues from terminal
Check CI/CD pipeline status and view build logs
Authenticate with GitLab using glab auth login
Clone and view repositories via glab CLI
limitations: Requires glab CLI to be installed locally on your system
Requires GitLab authentication via glab auth login before use
Cannot modify GitLab project settings directly through this skill
Self-hosted GitLab instances require prior glab configuration

use_cases.title: Monitor CI/CD pipelines
use_cases.description: Check pipeline status, view logs, and retry failed builds without leaving the terminal

use_cases.title: Review merge requests
use_cases.description: List, view, checkout, and approve merge requests with full comment context

use_cases.title: Track GitLab issues
use_cases.description: Create issues, track assignments, and manage issue discussions from command line

prompt_templates.title: List open merge requests
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all open merge requests for this repository

prompt_templates.title: Create merge request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a merge request with title 'Feature: Add user authentication' and description 'This PR adds OAuth login functionality'

prompt_templates.title: Check pipeline status
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the current CI/CD pipeline status? Show me the latest build logs

prompt_templates.title: Manage issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new issue for the bug we found in the payment module, then list all issues assigned to me

output_examples.input: Show me all open merge requests
output: !8 Feature: Add user authentication - Created by @alice, Assignee: @bob
!7 Fix: Memory leak in worker - Created by @charlie, Assignee: @me
!6 Update documentation - Created by @me, Assignee: unassigned
Use 'glab mr view <id> --comments' to see full discussion
Use 'glab ci trace' to view detailed logs
Created issue #42: Payment module timeout bug
Use 'glab issue view 42' to add more details

best_practices: Always verify glab authentication with 'glab auth status' before operations
Use '--comments' flag when viewing MRs or issues for complete context
Check 'glab ci status' before running new pipelines to avoid duplicate builds
anti_patterns: Running glab commands without first confirming authentication
Creating merge requests without checking for uncommitted local changes
Using pipeline commands on non-GitLab repositories

faq.question: How do I install glab CLI?
faq.answer: Install via Homebrew (brew install glab), apt (sudo apt install glab), or download from GitHub releases.

faq.question: Does this work with self-hosted GitLab?
faq.answer: Yes. Configure your GitLab instance with 'glab config set gitlab.com your-gitlab-url'.

faq.question: What permissions does glab need?
faq.answer: glab requires a GitLab API token with appropriate scopes like read_api or api depending on operations.

faq.question: Is my data sent to third parties?
faq.answer: glab communicates directly with your configured GitLab instance only. No external services involved.

faq.question: Why are commands not working?
faq.answer: Common issues: not authenticated (run glab auth status), wrong directory, or glab not installed.

faq.question: How is this different from git CLI?
faq.answer: git handles version control locally. glab provides GitLab-specific MRs, issues, and pipelines.
